lines.text: How did the war go?
Well, Your Grace, we're home. Actually, there's been a slight change of plan. I know it will come as a surprise, a pleasant one, I hope, but we sort of won.
You sort of *what*?
[There is an explosion and we see a huge mushroom cloud on the horizon]
Ladies and gentlemen, this is not the end of the film. However, something like this might easily happen, and we thought we should put you in the proper mood. And now, back to our story.
I warn you, madam - I know the entire Geneva Convention by heart!
Oh, how nice! You must recite it for me some evening; I play the harpsichord.
Remember, men, no matter what they do, don't talk.
What if they torture us?
Just don't talk!
Can we scream a little?
My idea was sound. Only an idiot could have won this war, and he did.
Men of Fenwick, where you hear the name of Grand Fenwick do your hearts swell with pride?
Yes!
And if your country calls will you rush to enlist?
No!
Oh.
We must declare war on the United States.
But we can never win such a war!

Of course not, but we could win the peace. I've given this a lot of thought gentlemen and I'm perfectly positive that I am right. You must remember, the Americans are a very strange people. Whereas other countries rarely forgive anything, the Americans forgive anything. There isn't a more profitable undertaking for any country than to declare war on the United States and to be defeated.
Remember, men. There is nothing wrong with surrendering to overwhelming powers, as long as it is done in a military manner.
Why is it so different from an H-bomb?
lines.character: Air Raid Warden in Physics Lab

lines.text: H-bomb? This new bomb is based on quodium, which is 100 times more powerful than hydrogen.
My father uses an H-bomb just to trigger this one.
Do give my love to your president, will you? And Mrs. Coolidge too.
You can turn around right now and kiss me if you want to.
Really?
Really.
A fine thing, the United States and the Grand Duchy of Fenwick are at war, and it takes the F.B.I. to find out about it.
Hey, you see that big building?
Well?
Well, I saw it first, it's mine.
My girl, and my bomb!
I move we declare war on the United States of America.
As leader of the party of the common man, I say that war is reprehensible, barbaric, unforgivable, and unthinkable. And I second the motion.
There isn't a more profitable undertaking for any country than to declare war on the United States and to be defeated.
Stay away from...

[about the Q-Bomb]
How should I carry it?
Carefully.
How did the war with the United States go, eh?
We won!
